intro: Psychotria bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with two distinct teeth at the base, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow or orange corona. Psychotria bidentata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
